comment.author: 62056398@N08
comment._content: These are my Great & Great-Great Grandparents!

comment.author: 75414574@N02
comment._content: Yes Emma, my grandmother(s) and greatgrandmother.   (First photo I have ever seen of my mum's mother and stepmother(auntie) together.

comment.author: 62056398@N08
comment._content: I'm finding this very exciting!  However Wendy mentioned no one knew where Bertha's grave is, so next weekend I am planning a trip to Jandowae, and possibly Bell to try and locate it.

comment.author: 75414574@N02
comment._content: I had the feeling that she passed away at Jandowae so more than likely (hope you have some luck).   We did not know very much about her as Olivia was our "grandma" all our  lives.

comment.author: 75414574@N02
comment._content: It is exciting isn't it Emma - I will try to find the birth, marriages and deaths certificates which I have somewhere (from Wendy) and see if we can narrow down where the cemetery is.

comment.author: 32605636@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/75414574@N02] It's so great for us to hear about people finding their families in pictures from our collections. Keep us posted on developments. YOu could also try searching for their names in the digitised newspapers from libraries across the country on Trove trove.nla.gov.au/newspaper
